comments.content:
It was indeed the time period hint that helped...   
   
Here's the next:   
   
 ![popquiz](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123449im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/22026.gif)
That was a quick one! Yes, Jim Parkinson's fabulous Hotel. Good job, Nicolai.

It must be my lucky day... :-)   
   
Here�s a new challenge:   
 ![hint 1](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123449im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/22035.gif)

Another sample?   
Any ideas what character it might be?

It's very close to E+F [Expressa Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123449/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/expressa/ef-light/?s=k), if it wasn't for the rounded corners and the slight flare to the upstroke.

No, not Expressa either, sorry...   
Here is a little more:   
 ![hint3](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123449im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/22104.gif)

Myfonts choked on all my frankenletters:   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123449im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/22111.gif)   
   
I'm KO'd � Randy

Nice start, Randy -- looking forward to your complete version of the typeface!   
   
Nicolai, I think it's time for a hint...

Let me start by saying that Randys 4th k is _surprisingly_   
close to the one from my "mystery font"!!!   
   
I am not good at giving hints...   
This time I will not make any qoutations ;-)   
   
This typeface was originally intented for use in children�s books.   
It has developed from being a plain sans serif to this semi serifed thing.   
A couple of years ago it was finally digitized...   
   
Please tell me if you want to see the entire character for comparison

Alright, it is getting late here in DK and I better get some sleep.   
I�ll post the entire character in the morning - unless someone tells me not to...   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123449im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/yawn.gif)

Here�s the full character:   
 ![hint4](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123449im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/22160.gif)   
Another hint:   
The foundry can celebrate its 10th anniversary next year.

_The foundry can celebrate its 10th anniversary next year._   
   
That describes Tiro, but I don't recall drawing this particular glyph. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123449im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

It�s not from Tiro, sorry.   
   
Another hint:   
The person who digitized this font also runs the foundry.

Neither Dutch nor French!   
   
Another hint:   
Recently some of you guys started a thread about buying fonts from this foundry...   
Among others Hrant and Tiffany recomended these "special" fonts...

That�s right Eduardo!!!   
Congratulations!   
   
Even though I posted an alternate character   
I don�t think I broke any "rules" this time, since all   
showings of Juvenis include this k... Anybody disagree?

Don't worry, Nikolai.   
Now to our next challenge:   
   
 ![idquiz](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123449im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/22176.gif)

good one Tiff!   
   
I have to kick myself on that one ...   
i've mentioned Madisonian here and elsewhere   
several times. And I recently spotted it in the   
Solotype catalog. ~doh.

It's Madisonian Bold actually, not Light.   
Anyway, good job. Your turn, Tiff. :-)

This is another of Miss Tiffany's cleverly misleading crop jobs. I've no idea what it is, but I'm amused by the thought that it might be the kind of Polish _ew_ that would send Adam Twardoch into fits.   
 ![Ew?](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123449im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/22210.gif)

q or p?   
   
design by Greg Thompson?

I propose a new rule (pun intended):   
All croppings must show a border (like Eduardo�s post)   
   
I say this because I have no idea how to turn that thing into a q. Here is one ugly duckling:   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518123449im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/22213.gif)
